verses.kjv: Judge me, O God, and plead my cause against an ungodly nation: O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man.
verses.ct: Defend me, God, and argue my case against a godless people. Rescue me from those who are dishonest and corrupt.

verses.kjv: For thou art the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me off? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
verses.ct: You are the God who gives me strength — so why have you rejected me? Why do I walk around grieving under the weight of my enemy's cruelty?

verses.kjv: O send out thy light and thy truth: let them lead me; let them bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy tabernacles.
verses.ct: Send your light and your truth to guide me. Let them bring me to your sacred mountain, to the place where you dwell.

verses.kjv: Then will I go unto the altar of God, unto God my exceeding joy: yea, upon the harp will I praise thee, O God my God.
verses.ct: Then I will approach the altar of God, the God who is my greatest joy. I will praise you with the harp, God — my God.

verses.kjv: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
verses.ct: Why are you so discouraged, my soul? Why are you so restless inside me? Put your hope in God, because I will still praise him — he is my salvation and my God.
